content.webTitle: Double trouble from easyJet's in-flight payment glitch

fields.headline: Double trouble from easyJet's in-flight payment glitch
fields.bodyText: I purchased two Gatwick Express tickets from an easyJet stewardess while on a flight to London. During the transaction, the till roll ran out of paper and the tickets couldn't be printed, so I was told I would have to be charged again when the till roll was replenished as they are no longer able to cancel in-flight transactions. The stewardess promised that she would refund me when we landed, but four months on I'm still waiting. MvD, London The inability to cancel transactions sounds a most felicitous inconvenience for the airline. When a company says it has to charge you twice to circumvent technical obstacles – and this is not as rare as you might think – slam your wallet shut and shop elsewhere. I had to chase easyJet for three weeks before it issued a bald apology. It says its supplier has now refunded you directly. If you need help email Anna Tims at your.problems@observer.co.uk or write to Your Problems, The Observer, Kings Place, 90 York Way, London N1 9GU. Please include an address and phone number.
